businessSummary.oneLiner: The world's largest EV maker pivoting into a 'Physical AI Platform' spanning robotaxis, humanoid robots, and energy storage.
businessSummary.description: Tesla is rapidly transforming from an EV manufacturer into an integrated AI, robotics, and energy platform company. FY2025 revenue was $94.8B, marking the first-ever annual revenue decline (-2.9%), with net income plunging 46.5%. However, on Feb 17 the first Cybercab production unit rolled off the line at Giga Texas, bringing the robotaxi era closer to reality. FSD cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion. The Netherlands RDW granted FSD Supervised approval, opening European expansion. Meanwhile, the Austin robotaxi service has logged 14 crashes since launch (4x human crash rate), the $243M Autopilot verdict was upheld, and California DMV reached a marketing settlement. Model S/X discontinuation is confirmed for Q2 2026, with Fremont converting to Optimus robot production.
howTheyMakeMoney: Vehicle sales: ~73% of revenue ($69.5B). Model 3/Y are core, Model S/X discontinued Q2 2026
Energy business: ~14% of revenue ($12.8B, +27% YoY). Megapack utility-scale storage. 46.7GWh deployed in 2025 (+48% YoY)
Services/Other: ~13% of revenue ($12.5B). Supercharger network, insurance, maintenance, parts
FSD subscription: $99/month autonomous driving software (subscription-only from Feb 2026)
keyProducts: Model 3/Y (core EVs, JD Power 2026 EV satisfaction #1 and #2)
Cybertruck (electric pickup, new lower-priced AWD $59,990 launched 2/20)
Cybercab (autonomous robotaxi, first production unit 2/17, $30,000, April mass production)
Optimus (humanoid robot, Fremont factory conversion, 1M/year long-term target)
Megapack (utility-scale energy storage, 46.7GWh in 2025, Megapack 3 coming)
FSD (Full Self-Driving, 8.2B miles cumulative, subscription-only, Netherlands EU approval)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extreme premium based on FY2025 EPS of $1.08. Reflects robotaxi/AI growth expectations

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on 2026 consensus EPS of $2.09. Significant growth premium remains

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: First-ever annual revenue decline. 2026 consensus: +9-15% rebound

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Down from 7.8% in FY2024. Price cuts, competition, and rising CapEx weigh

keyMetrics.name: Gross Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Slight improvement from 17.9% in FY2024 despite price reductions

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Industry-lowest level of financial health. Current ratio 2.16

keyMetrics.name: ROE
keyMetrics.interpretation: Declined sharply from 13% in FY2024 due to 46.5% net income drop

growthDrivers.title: Cybercab production begins, robotaxi era dawns
growthDrivers.description: First steerless/pedalless Cybercab unit rolled off at Giga Texas on Feb 17. Priced at $30,000, full production starts April. Plans to expand robotaxi service to 9 US cities in H1.

growthDrivers.title: FSD 8.2B miles + subscription pivot + first EU approval
growthDrivers.description: FSD Supervised surpassed 8.2B cumulative miles. Switched to $99/month subscription-only model in February. Netherlands RDW granted first EU approval for FSD Supervised.

growthDrivers.title: Optimus robot: Fremont factory conversion underway
growthDrivers.description: Post Model S/X discontinuation (Q2 2026), Fremont line converting to Optimus humanoid robot factory. Gen 3 production started, 1,000+ units operating in-factory. 1M/year long-term target.

growthDrivers.title: 2026 CapEx $20B+ and energy business high growth
growthDrivers.description: Record CapEx guidance of $20B+ for 2026. Energy storage deployed 46.7GWh in 2025 (+48% YoY). Megapack 3 production upcoming for further acceleration.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Dominant #1 in US EV market with 50%+ share, though BYD has overtaken globally. Vertical integration across software, manufacturing, and energy plus 8.2B miles of autonomous driving data form the core moat.

moats.description: 8.2B FSD Supervised miles (including 3B urban miles). Overwhelmingly larger training dataset vs. competitors.
In-house battery (4680), custom chips (HW4), software (FSD), charging infrastructure (Supercharger). Expanding to robots and energy.
NACS adopted as North American EV charging standard. GM, Ford, Rivian and others depend on Tesla's Supercharger network.

competitors.name: BYD
competitors.detail: 2025 global EV sales leader (2.26M units, +28%). 35% China market share. US entry limited by tariffs

competitors.name: Waymo (Alphabet)
competitors.detail: $16B funding raised, $126B valuation. 400K+ weekly rides, 127M autonomous miles. Expanding to 20 cities

competitors.name: Rivian (RIVN)
competitors.detail: R2 SUV ($45,000) launching 2026 to compete directly with Model Y. Sub-200K annual volume

competitors.name: GM
competitors.detail: ~13% US EV share growing rapidly. Diverse model lineup on Ultium platform

recentNews.headline: TSLA down 2% on Monday, autonomous driving competition and EV demand concerns
recentNews.significance: Selling pressure from week start, investor sentiment weakening

recentNews.headline: Should you buy TSLA after Cybertruck price cuts? Analysts divided
recentNews.significance: Mean target $407, range $25 to $600 shows extreme divergence

recentNews.headline: Tesla fails to overturn $243M Autopilot jury verdict
recentNews.significance: Autonomous driving legal risk escalating, potential precedent for future lawsuits

recentNews.headline: Austin robotaxi service: 14 crashes since launch, 4x human crash rate
recentNews.significance: Safety concerns intensify ahead of Cybercab mass production without steering/pedals

recentNews.headline: Tesla guides 2026 CapEx above $20B, record investment level
recentNews.significance: Largest-ever capital expenditure plan, near-term profitability pressure

analystOpinions.notableComment: 42% of 54 analysts rate Buy. CNN median 1-year target $480. Wedbush maintains $600, Tigress Financial reinstated Buy at $550. GLJ Research keeps $25 low target.

risks.title: Extreme valuation premium
risks.description: Forward P/E of 195x prices in perfect execution across robotaxi, robots, and energy. Any setback could trigger a sharp decline.

risks.title: Robotaxi safety concerns
risks.description: 14 crashes in Austin since launch (4x human crash rate). Cybercab has no steering wheel or pedals, regulatory risk could escalate with April mass production.

risks.title: Autopilot litigation and regulatory risk
risks.description: $243M jury verdict upheld. California FSD marketing settlement. Potential precedent for additional lawsuits.

risks.title: EV demand slowdown and intensifying competition
risks.description: FY2025 first-ever revenue decline (-2.9%). Net income down 46.5%. BYD global leader, Rivian R2 launch adding pressure.

risks.title: Elon Musk political risk
risks.description: DOGE government involvement damaging brand image. European sales underperforming.

buyReasons.title: Cybercab mass production begins, robotaxi market first-mover
buyReasons.rationale: First production unit on Feb 17, full production April. At $30,000 price point, lower cost than Waymo. Plans for 9 US cities in H1.

buyReasons.title: FSD 8.2B mile data advantage + European approval
buyReasons.rationale: 60x more data than Waymo (127M miles). Netherlands RDW approval opens EU market entry.

buyReasons.title: Energy business high growth + FCF recovery
buyReasons.rationale: Energy storage 46.7GWh (+48% YoY). FCF $6.2B recovered +74%. $20B+ CapEx accelerating future investment.

overallOpinion: Tesla stands at a historic inflection point, transforming from an automaker into an AI robotics platform. Cybercab production and FSD European approval are strong catalysts, but a Forward P/E of 195x requires flawless execution across all fronts. The 14 robotaxi crashes (4x human rate), $243M lawsuit loss, and first-ever revenue decline are real risks. Trading below both 50-day and 200-day moving averages signals technical weakness. Suitable only for investors with strong conviction in the long-term vision. Near-term, the $400 support level is the key battleground.

sources.name: Stock Analysis
sources.description: FY2025 financials: Revenue $94.8B, Net Income $3.8B, EPS $1.08

sources.name: CNBC
sources.description: Q4 2025 results: Net income plunged 61% to $840M
